# Aim of the Session

Offer an overview about

- the necessity of Reproducible Research
- present the ease of a reproducible research practice thanks to modern tools
- persuade you by presenting "hands-on" case studies

---

# List of Presentations

1. .bold[Daniel Knitter] Introduction to Reproducible research

2. .bold[Joe Roe] `fieldwalkr`: an R package for spatial sampling and field survey 
simulation

3. .bold[Wolfgang Hamer] `FuzzyLandscapes` - A reproducible approach to analyse uncertain 
parameters

4. .strikethrough[.bold[Justin Pargeter] Open-air preservation of miniaturised lithics: computer simulations and experimental research in the Cederberg Mountains, southern Africa 
]

5. .bold[Vincent Haburaj] Hyperspectral imaging for improving stratigraphic interpretation in 
Yeha, Ethiopia

6. .bold[Jesús Corsà] Settlement and territory in the north of the district/taifa of Lárida 
(northeast of the al-Andalus 11th and 12th centuries)

7. Final discussion
